alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 10:06PM CDT until August 01 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT MONDAY FOR SOUTHWESTERN ANDERSON, KNOX AND NORTHWESTERN SEVIER COUNTIES... At 1106 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing in some locations across Knoxville. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Sevierville, Clinton, Oliver Springs, Halls, Powell, Bearden, Lake Forest, Maloneyville, Karns, Mascot, Kimberlin Heights, Seymour, McMahan and Kodak. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
